FeedItems.Title: Getting Started With NuGet 5.8
FeedItems.Summary:
Getting started with NuGet 5.8
NuGet 5.8 is included in Visual Studio 16.8 and .NET 5.0 out of the box. You can also download NuGet 5.8 for Windows, macOS, and Linux as a standalone executable.
NuGet...

Events.RelatedBody:
@MGWVc### For issues regarding the NuGet client tools (the Visual Studio extension, NuGet.exe command line tool, etc.), file a bug on [NuGet Home](https://github.com/nuget/home/issues).

### Describe the bug
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Using this git commit of NuGetGallery '...'
2. Run this code '....'
3. See error

### Expected behavior
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

### Screenshots
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

### Additional context
Add any other context about the problem here.

Twitter.com/MGWVc### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
A clear and concise description of what the problem is.
Example: I am trying to do [...] but [...]

### Describe the solution you'd like
A clear and concise description of what you want to happen. Include any alternative solutions you've considered.

### Additional context
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Latest release version of NuGet.Packaging and NuGet.Protocol." (#8335) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Progress on https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8230

To enable Gallery to accept new OSI and FSF approved licenses need to bump NuGet.Packaging version.
NuGet.Protocol was updated just to align with NuGet.Packaging and get off preview version.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "The number of Downloads for my lib stays at zero whereas We have downloaded it tens of times" (#8334) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Bug Descrption
The number of __Downloads for my lib stays at zero__ whereas we have downloaded it tens of times at work or from home. This is not a good incentive to ¬´¬†sell¬†¬ª the lib ;-)

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Open https://www.nuget.org/packages/Diverse/ and see 0 as downloads for the component
2. Download the components (either via nuget package manager in visual studio or through the download package link on nuget.org
3. Wait a while, refresh the page https://www.nuget.org/packages/Diverse/ : the downloads count remains zero...

### Expected behavior
I‚Äôm expecting the nuget.org gallery to display the relevant number of downloads for my package. At least not zero (which is not a good selling argument ;-)

### Screenshots

![6D14A75F-E5A4-44D3-8C5D-1C1FFA25BF1C](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2824069/100060150-761d4300-2e2c-11eb-9dcc-a5b444c717a3.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Fix two scroll bar at status page " (#8330) at NuGet/NuGetGallery

Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8313

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Revert "add description for readmore"" (#8332) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Closed issue "There should be some error or warning in Error List or Output window when trying to install a package already packed with an invalid embedded icon format" (#10310) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet version: NuGet Client Dev\5.9.0.6969
VS Version: Master\30719.130
OS: Windows-10-Enterprise-19H2
## Detailed repro steps 
1.	Make a package (called InvalidFwPackage) with an invalid embedded icon format before fixing of bug 9311 (please follow the steps of the bug).
2.	Create a Console (.NET Framework 4.8) project in VS and open the PM UI.
3.	Click the settings button on PM UI and add the invalid package source into ‚ÄúOptions->NuGet Package Manager->Package Sources‚Äù.
4.	Select the invalid package source in the ‚ÄúPackage sources‚Äù dropdown list in PM UI and go to ‚ÄúBrowse‚Äù tab to try to install it.
## Expected
There should be some error or warning in Error List or Output window.
## Actual
The package already packed with an invalid embedded icon format can be installed without any error or warning as below.
![ExistInvalidIcon](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/99805950-36c6cc00-2b78-11eb-8dfe-168953238b43.JPG)
## Note
1.It is not a regression, we think that should be a part of the fixing of bug 9311.
2.InvalidFwPackage is the package with an invalid embedded icon format created before fixing of bug 9311.
[InvalidFwPackage.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/5573816/InvalidFwPackage.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "How to programming set package management format" (#10323) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Please read the following information before posting the issue.

## Before posting the issue...

* If you're having trouble with the NuGet.org Website, please post in [NuGetGallery issues](http://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues)
* If you're having trouble with the NuGet client tools (the Visual Studio extension, NuGet.exe command line tool, etc.), you are in the right place.

Remove the content above here and fill out details below.

## Details about Problem

NuGet product used: NuGet.VisualStudio

NuGet version: 4.5.0

OS version: win10 v1607

Hi I encounter some problem about using NuGet.VisualStudio to develop Visix programe.

When I use IVsPackageInstaller.InstallPackage(null, project, moq, null, false).

I always get format "0" (not reference format) in installing package.

I realize when source fill with null, Installing process will use user's configured sources, I am sure my configured source management format which select format 1.

Dose any lose step, when i use InstallPackage of IVsPackageInstaller.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Parallel restore randomly fails package certificate trust (in container)" (#10322) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used: NuGet.exe

NuGet version: 5.8.0.6930 (via Pipelines `NuGetToolInstaller@0` task)

VS version: 2019 Build Tools v16.8.2

OS version: Server 2019 (1809 build 17763.1577) + Docker hosting mcr.microsoft.com/dotnet/framework/runtime:3.5-windowsservercore-ltsc2019

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: New scenario for us

## Description

1. Prepare a Pipelines Docker-based build agent using steps similar to those at https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/pipelines/agents/docker?view=azure-devops#windows and using the `--once` agent option.

2. Use the resulting image with Docker Swarm on a 32-core host (so there are a couple of dozen agents running simultaneously).

3. Start multiple builds for solutions containing 100+ projects each with restore steps, using a nuget.config containing `<add key='maxHttpRequestsPerSource' value='4' />`.

What we are seeing is failures validating packages from nuget.org (`PackageSignatureValidity: False`). The failures appear nondeterministic -- the specific packages that succeed or fail look to be different each time, and the number of packages failing during a given run is not consistent either -- but the failure becomes more probable if more than one container's agent is restoring simultaneously.

Adding the `-DisableParallelProcessing` flag seems to make the problem go away, at the cost of a longer time to restore, while lowering `maxHttpRequestsPerSource` seems to have no effect.

Speculation: each container sees itself has having 32 CPUs, so NuGet starts 32 concurrent restore jobs (if parallel processing is left on). The error messages suggest some sort of failure during certificate validation; assuming the certificate doesn't change but the outcome does, perhaps a request rate limit is being hit somewhere?

### Verbose Logs
(Excerpts)

> NU3028: Package 'Microsoft.AspNet.Razor 3.2.3' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': The repository primary signature's timestamp found a chain building issue: UntrustedRoot: A certificate chain processed, but terminated in a root certificate which is not trusted by the trust provider.
> NU3018: Package 'Microsoft.AspNet.Razor 3.2.3' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': The repository primary signature found a chain building issue: UntrustedRoot: A certificate chain processed, but terminated in a root certificate which is not trusted by the trust provider.
> Errors in C:\vsts\_work\1\s\Web\<project_name>.csproj
>     NU3028: Package 'Microsoft.AspNet.Razor 3.2.3' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': The repository primary signature's timestamp found a chain building issue: UntrustedRoot: A certificate chain processed, but terminated in a root certificate which is not trusted by the trust provider.
>     NU3018: Package 'Microsoft.AspNet.Razor 3.2.3' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': The repository primary signature found a chain building issue: UntrustedRoot: A certificate chain processed, but terminated in a root certificate which is not trusted by the trust provider.

Later:

> PackageSignatureVerificationLog: PackageIdentity: Microsoft.AspNet.Razor.3.2.3 Source: https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json PackageSignatureValidity: False
> Package 'Microsoft.AspNet.Razor 3.2.3' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': Signature Hash Algorithm: SHA256
> Package 'Microsoft.AspNet.Razor 3.2.3' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': Timestamp: 12/14/2018 5:55:55 AM

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "November dry run for custom V2 OData query deprecation" (#48) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
We announced the deprecation of custom V2 OData queries (https://github.com/NuGet/Announcements/issues/37) last year and we will begin blocking endpoints used by 3rd party clients in **February 2021**. 

We will conduct **a dry run of the OData deprecation** to ensure that there are no surprises for users, which is scheduled to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. The goal is to help you identify systems that may be affected and will give you an opportunity to take action before we permanently remove support for select v2 endpoints.
¬†
There will be two stages in the brown-out to accommodate a variety of usage scenarios. During these times, we will be heavily monitoring social media and other communication channels to address questions and concerns. 
	¬∑ **Nov. 11, 2020** ‚Äì 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each
	¬∑ **Nov. 17 & 18, 2020**¬† ‚Äì¬†48 hours

Please let us know about your questions or concerns on [this discussion post](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7423).
¬†
Refer to the table below to identify the test slot time in your time zone.
	¬∑ UTC-9 to UTC-2 ‚Äì¬†[Green test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Green+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3923&ah=4)
	¬∑ UTC-1 to UTC+6 ‚Äì¬†[Yellow test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Yellow+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3915&ah=4)
	¬∑ UTC+7 to UTC-10 ‚Äì¬†[Blue test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Blue+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3909&ah=4)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "November dry run for custom V2 OData query deprecation" (#48) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
We announced the deprecation of custom V2 OData queries (https://github.com/NuGet/Announcements/issues/37) last year and we will begin blocking endpoints used by 3rd party clients in **February 2021**. 

We will conduct **a dry run of the OData deprecation** to ensure that there are no surprises for users, which is scheduled to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. The goal is to help you identify systems that may be affected and will give you an opportunity to take action before we permanently remove support for select v2 endpoints.
¬†
There will be two stages in the brown-out to accommodate a variety of usage scenarios. During these times, we will be heavily monitoring social media and other communication channels to address questions and concerns. 
	¬∑ **Nov. 11, 2020** ‚Äì 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each
	¬∑ **Nov. 17 & 18, 2020**¬† ‚Äì¬†48 hours

Please let us know about your questions or concerns on [this discussion post](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7423).
¬†
Refer to the table below to identify the test slot time in your time zone.
	¬∑ UTC-9 to UTC-2 ‚Äì¬†[Green test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Green+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3923&ah=4)
